intro: Astragalus oophorus, commonly known as the "eggplant milkvetch," is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellow pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a low, sprawling growth habit. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces pods that contain small, kidney-shaped seeds. Astragalus oophorus is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
